name: Chicken Broccoli Stir-Fry
description: Quick and easy Asian-inspired low-carb meal. Ready in just 20 minutes with tender chicken and crisp broccoli.

instructions.instruction: Prepare sauce: Mix soy sauce, chicken broth, sesame oil, and cornstarch in a bowl. Set aside.
Heat wok or large pan over high heat. Add vegetable oil.
instructions.tip: Wok should be very hot - heat until slightly smoking.

instructions.instruction: Add half the chicken strips. Don't stir for 1 minute, then stir-fry for 2 minutes.
instructions.tip: Don't overcrowd, cook in two batches.

instructions.instruction: Remove cooked chicken, repeat with remaining chicken.
After removing all chicken, add broccoli to the pan.
Add 2 tablespoons water and cover. Steam for 2 minutes.
instructions.tip: Broccoli should stay bright green and slightly crisp.

instructions.instruction: Add garlic and ginger, cook for 30 seconds.
Pour sauce over. Stir until sauce thickens, 1-2 minutes.
Remove from heat. Garnish with sesame seeds, green onion, and optional pepper flakes.

tips: High heat and quick cooking (wok hei) enhances flavor.
Broccoli is rich in vitamin C and fiber.
Skip the rice for a low-carb meal.
Ready in under 20 minutes - perfect for busy days.
storageInfo: Refrigerate for up to 3 days. Reheat briefly in a pan.
servingSuggestion: Serve over brown rice or cauliflower rice.
variations: Beef or shrimp also work great.
Add mushrooms, carrots, and snap peas for more vegetables.
Try teriyaki sauce for a different flavor profile.
